posts.name: Fedor Indutny
posts.cooked:
Hi everyone! The Signal team is releasing a new version of Signal Desktop, v7.32.0-beta.1. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta here .

Release notes:

  • Thanks to some small optimizations, this update slightly reduces the size of the app by approximately 4 megabytes. That’s enough room for you to send the equivalent of about 4 books’ worth of text messages (or 2-3 animated GIFs) without taking up any extra space.
  • If Wayland is your compositing window manager (and not just the name of a blacksmith you vaguely remember from Beowulf) you’ll be happy to hear that we also fixed a bug with the screen sharing button on Linux.

Commit changes: Comparing v7.31.0-beta.1…v7.32.0-beta.1 · signalapp/Signal-Desktop · GitHub

Thanks for being a beta tester!

Previous beta: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.31 release

posts.name: Xashyar
posts.cooked:
indutny-signal:

Wayland is your compositing window manager (and not just the name of a blacksmith you vaguely remember

Gotta hand it to the Signal team for writing this

New Version: 7.32.0-beta.1

59 new commits since 7.31.0-beta.1:

Show commits

  • v7.32.0-alpha.1 [1]

  • Update better-sqlite3 to 9.0.6 [2]

  • Use uuidv7 in callDisposition [3]

  • Update electron to 33.0.1 [4]

  • Update rezip-electron to 2.0.0 [5]

  • Fix handling CallLogEvent sync for call link targets [6]

  • Graceful fallback for unsupported body range type [7]

  • Remove >_< from emoji substitutions [8]

  • Don't mirror screensharing preview in PiP [9]

  • Fix spacing of your own icons in call link participant list [10]

  • Add ProfileKeyForCall conversation job [11]

  • Link-and-sync [12]

  • Improve logging of endorsements expirations [13]

  • Deprecate macOS Catalina [14]

  • Fix call link delete to require inactive call [15]

  • Upgrade better-sqlite3 to 9.0.7 [16]

  • Clarify behavior of group deletion [17]

  • Update libsignal to v0.59.0, add support for mock server test with libsignal [18]

  • Disable link-and-sync in Alpha [19]

  • Ensure that call history messages are marked read when they are seen [20]

  • Fix GSE for delivery receipts in inactive groups [21]

  • Bump electron from 33.0.1 to 33.0.2 [22] (reverted by [23])

  • Revert "Bump electron from 33.0.1 to 33.0.2" [23] (reverts [22])

  • Fix group update deadlock inside conversation queue [24]

  • Save storage for defunct and pending call links [25]

  • Re-enable link-and-sync in Alpha [26]

  • Fix heic/heif extension name case sensitivity [27]

  • Fix group search visibility [28]

  • Allow downloading multiple images into one directory [29]

  • Release notes for 7.31 [30]

  • Update strings [31]

  • Update DNS fallback [32]

  • Add backup attachment restore idle state [33]

  • Centralize logic for finding/fetching the ringing call [34]

  • Remove unnecesary profile fetch assertion [35]

  • Update captcha response error handling [36]

  • Add test for call link storage [37]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.48.4 [38]

  • Allow link previews without image or title [39]

  • Refresh group state if missing group members [40]

  • switch to v2/calling/relays endpoint [41]

  • Log query stats during backup import [42]

  • Fix pressing screenshare multiple times on Linux Wayland [43]

  • Use libsignal PassThroughs instead of our own [44]

  • Fix link-and-sync in Alpha [45]

  • Batch attachment download jobs [46]

  • Only show download button if message has attachments to download [47]

  • handleBlocked: Continue on if we receive non-ACI [48]

  • Default test-electron worker count to 1 locally [49]

  • Unlink on backup interruption [50]

  • Improve chat search filtering [51]

  • Only set last group fetch for server updates [52]

  • Fix download media banner styles [53]

  • Import/export view-once messages [54]

  • Faster backup import for large conversation count [55]

  • Allow link-and-sync transfer to be in any CDN [56]

  • Release notes for 7.32 [57]

  • Update strings [58]

  • 7.32.0-beta.1 [59]

posts.name: Fedor Indutny
posts.cooked: Thank you! We are tracking this bug, but didn’t get a chance to look into it yet. Sorry

No problem
Glad you are tracking it

Ok apparently the problem has been there for a while :

github.com/signalapp/Signal-Desktop

Deleted contacts and groups are shown when forwarding a message

opened 09:37PM - 13 Feb 24 UTC
closed 03:34PM - 22 Apr 24 UTC
xduugu
Bug

### Using a supported version? - [X] I have searched searched open and closed i…ssues for duplicates. - [X] I am using Signal-Desktop as provided by the Signal team, not a 3rd-party package. ### Overall summary When forwarding a message, a "Forward To" modal opens where the contacts and/or groups to forward to should be selected. This list is not filtered, so that old deleted contacts and groups can be selected. ### Steps to reproduce 1. Go to any chat. 2. Right-click a message and select "Forward" ### Expected result The "Forward To" modal should only list your current contacts and groups, not historic ones. ### Actual result The "Forward To" modal lists groups you left and contacts that were deleted or which left signal. ### Screenshots _No response_ ### Signal version 6.47.0 ### Operating system Linux ### Version of Signal on your phone _No response_ ### Link to debug log _No response_
